extension.dc:title: Darwin Core Taxon
extension.name: Taxon
extension.dc:description: The category of information pertaining to taxonomic names, taxon name usages, or taxon concepts. Replaces version issued 2015-04-24 to match latest release of the Darwin Core standard.

property.name: taxonID
property.dc:description: An identifier for the set of taxon information (data associated with the Taxon class). May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set.

property.name: scientificNameID
property.dc:description: An identifier for the nomenclatural (not taxonomic) details of a scientific name.

property.name: acceptedNameUsageID
property.dc:description: An identifier for the name usage (documented meaning of the name according to a source) of the currently valid (zoological) or accepted (botanical) taxon.

property.name: parentNameUsageID
property.dc:description: An identifier for the name usage (documented meaning of the name according to a source) of the direct, most proximate higher-rank parent taxon (in a classification) of the most specific element of the scientificName.

property.name: originalNameUsageID
property.dc:description: An identifier for the name usage (documented meaning of the name according to a source) in which the terminal element of the scientificName was originally established under the rules of the associated nomenclaturalCode.

property.name: nameAccordingToID
property.dc:description: An identifier for the source in which the specific taxon concept circumscription is defined or implied. See nameAccordingTo.

property.name: nameAccordingToID
property.dc:description: An identifier for the source in which the specific taxon concept circumscription is defined or implied. See nameAccordingTo.

property.name: taxonConceptID
property.dc:description: An identifier for the taxonomic concept to which the record refers - not for the nomenclatural details of a taxon.

property.name: scientificName
property.dc:description: The full scientific name, with authorship and date information if known. When forming part of an Identification, this should be the name in lowest level taxonomic rank that can be determined. This term should not contain identification qualifications, which should instead be supplied in the IdentificationQualifier term.
property.examples: "Coleoptera" (order). "Vespertilionidae" (family). "Manis" (genus). "Ctenomys sociabilis" (genus + specificEpithet). "Ambystoma tigrinum diaboli" (genus + specificEpithet + infraspecificEpithet). "Roptrocerus typographi (Györfi, 1952)" (genus + specificEpithet + scientificNameAuthorship), "Quercus agrifolia var. oxyadenia (Torr.) J.T. Howell" (genus + specificEpithet + taxonRank + infraspecificEpithet + scientificNameAuthorship).

property.name: acceptedNameUsage
property.dc:description: The full name, with authorship and date information if known, of the currently valid (zoological) or accepted (botanical) taxon.

property.name: parentNameUsage
property.dc:description: The full name, with authorship and date information if known, of the direct, most proximate higher-rank parent taxon (in a classification) of the most specific element of the scientificName.

property.name: originalNameUsage
property.dc:description: The taxon name, with authorship and date information if known, as it originally appeared when first established under the rules of the associated nomenclaturalCode. The basionym (botany) or basonym (bacteriology) of the scientificName or the senior/earlier homonym for replaced names.

property.name: nameAccordingTo
property.dc:description: The reference to the source in which the specific taxon concept circumscription is defined or implied - traditionally signified by the Latin "sensu" or "sec." (from secundum, meaning "according to"). For taxa that result from identifications, a reference to the keys, monographs, experts and other sources should be given.
property.examples: "McCranie, J. R., D. B. Wake, and L. D. Wilson. 1996. The taxonomic status of Bolitoglossa schmidti, with comments on the biology of the Mesoamerican salamander Bolitoglossa dofleini (Caudata: Plethodontidae). Carib. J. Sci. 32:395-398.", "Werner Greuter 2008". "Lilljeborg 1861, Upsala Univ. Arsskrift, Math. Naturvet., pp. 4, 5"

property.name: namePublishedIn
property.dc:description: A reference for the publication in which the scientificName was originally established under the rules of the associated nomenclaturalCode.
property.examples: "Pearson O. P., and M. I. Christie. 1985. Historia Natural, 5(37):388", "Forel, Auguste, Diagnosies provisoires de quelques espèces nouvelles de fourmis de Madagascar, récoltées par M. Grandidier., Annales de la Societe Entomologique de Belgique, Comptes-rendus des Seances 30, 1886"

property.name: namePublishedInYear
property.dc:description: The four-digit year in which the scientificName was published.

property.name: higherClassification
property.dc:description: A list (concatenated and separated) of taxa names terminating at the rank immediately superior to the taxon referenced in the taxon record. Comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `), with terms in order from the highest taxonomic rank to the lowest.
property.examples: "Plantae | Tracheophyta | Magnoliopsida | Ranunculales | Ranunculaceae | Ranunculus", "Animalia", "Animalia | Chordata | Vertebrata | Mammalia | Theria | Eutheria | Rodentia | Hystricognatha | Hystricognathi | Ctenomyidae | Ctenomyini | Ctenomys"

property.name: kingdom
property.dc:description: The full scientific name of the kingdom in which the taxon is classified.

property.name: phylum
property.dc:description: The full scientific name of the phylum or division in which the taxon is classified.

property.name: class
property.dc:description: The full scientific name of the class in which the taxon is classified.

property.name: order
property.dc:description: The full scientific name of the order in which the taxon is classified.

property.name: family
property.dc:description: The full scientific name of the family in which the taxon is classified.

property.name: genus
property.dc:description: The full scientific name of the genus in which the taxon is classified.

property.name: subgenus
property.dc:description: The full scientific name of the subgenus in which the taxon is classified. Values should include the genus to avoid homonym confusion.

property.name: specificEpithet
property.dc:description: The name of the first or species epithet of the scientificName.

property.name: infraspecificEpithet
property.dc:description: The name of the lowest or terminal infraspecific epithet of the scientificName, excluding any rank designation.

property.name: taxonRank
property.dc:description: The taxonomic rank of the most specific name in the scientificName. Comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

property.name: verbatimTaxonRank
property.dc:description: The taxonomic rank of the most specific name in the scientificName as it appears in the original record.

property.name: scientificNameAuthorship
property.dc:description: The authorship information for the scientificName formatted according to the conventions of the applicable nomenclaturalCode.

property.name: vernacularName
property.dc:description: A common or vernacular name.

property.name: nomenclaturalCode
property.dc:description: The nomenclatural code (or codes in the case of an ambiregnal name) under which the scientificName is constructed. Comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

property.name: taxonomicStatus
property.dc:description: The status of the use of the scientificName as a label for a taxon. Requires taxonomic opinion to define the scope of a taxon. Rules of priority then are used to define the taxonomic status of the nomenclature contained in that scope, combined with the experts opinion. It must be linked to a specific taxonomic reference that defines the concept. Comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

property.name: nomenclaturalStatus
property.dc:description: The status related to the original publication of the name and its conformance to the relevant rules of nomenclature. It is based essentially on an algorithm according to the business rules of the code. It requires no taxonomic opinion.

property.name: taxonRemarks
property.dc:description: Comments or notes about the taxon or name.
property.examples: "this name is a misspelling in common use"

property.name: modified
property.dc:description: The most recent date-time on which the resource was changed. Comments: Recommended best practice is to use a date that conforms to ISO 8601-1:2019.
property.examples: "1963-03-08T14:07-0600" (8 Mar 1963 at 2:07pm in the time zone six hours earlier than UTC). "2009-02-20T08:40Z" (20 February 2009 8:40am UTC). "2018-08-29T15:19" (3:19pm local time on 29 August 2018). "1809-02-12" (some time during 12 February 1809). "1906-06" (some time in June 1906). "1971" (some time in the year 1971). "2007-03-01T13:00:00Z/2008-05-11T15:30:00Z" (some time during the interval between 1 March 2007 1pm UTC and 11 May 2008 3:30pm UTC). "1900/1909" (some time during the interval between the beginning of the year 1900 and the end of the year 1909). "2007-11-13/15" (some time in the interval between 13 November 2007 and 15 November 2007).

property.name: language
property.dc:description: A language of the resource. Comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as RFC 5646.

property.name: license
property.dc:description: A legal document giving official permission to do something with the resource.

property.name: rightsHolder
property.dc:description: A person or organization owning or managing rights over the resource.
property.examples: "The Regents of the University of California"

property.name: accessRights
property.dc:description: Information about who can access the resource or an indication of its security status. Comments: Access Rights may include information regarding access or restrictions based on privacy, security, or other policies.

property.name: bibliographicCitation
property.dc:description: A bibliographic reference for the resource as a statement indicating how this record should be cited (attributed) when used. Comments: Recommended practice is to include sufficient bibliographic detail to identify the resource as unambiguously as possible.
property.examples: Specimen example: "Museum of Vertebrate Zoology, UC Berkeley. MVZ Mammal Collection (Arctos). Record ID: http://arctos.database.museum/guid/MVZ:Mamm:165861?seid=101356. Source: http://ipt.vertnet.org:8080/ipt/resource.do?r=mvz_mammal". Taxon example: "Oliver P. Pearson. 1985. Los tuco-tucos (genera Ctenomys) de los Parques Nacionales Lanin y Nahuel Huapi, Argentina Historia Natural, 5(37):337-343.".

property.name: informationWithheld
property.dc:description: Additional information that exists, but that has not been shared in the given record.
property.examples: "location information not given for endangered species", "collector identities withheld | ask about tissue samples"

property.name: datasetID
property.dc:description: An identifier for the set of data. May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to a collection or institution.

property.name: datasetName
property.dc:description: The name identifying the data set from which the record was derived.

property.name: references
property.dc:description: A related resource that is referenced, cited, or otherwise pointed to by the described resource.
